attributes.action: compel the post office to scrap its disproportionate handling fee for underpaid items
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Royal Mail currently charges a substantial 'handling fee' to the recipients of letters or parcels where the postage was underpaid by the sender, even though the recipient committed no offence.

Not only is this practice morally wrong in that it punishes the wrong person (the recipient) rather than the sender who commit the offence of underpaying, but the size of the handling fee (currently £1) is often completely disproportionate to the underpayment being collected, which is often much less than the 'handling fee'.

It is already sufficient inconvenience to the recipient to have to go to the collection office, queue up and pay the underpayment - without being punished with an additional 'handling fee' - an immoral fine by any other name
